004package kut;
005
006/** Thread management */
007public class Thr {
008  Thr () {}
009
010  /**
011   * Start 'fn' in thread apart.<p>
012   * Example: <pre>
013   *    Thr.run(() -> Task.process());
014   * </pre>
015   * @param fn Action to run.
016   */
017  public static void run (Runnable fn) {
018    new Thread(fn).start();
019  }
020
021  /**
022   * Start 'fn' in thread apart, waiting at most 'millis' milliseconds. After
023   * this time the thread will be interrupted and 'onInterrupt' executed.<p>
024   * Example: <pre>
025   *    Thr.run(
026   *      () -> Task.process(),
027   *      2000,
028   *      () -> System.out.println("LOG--0")
029   *    );
030   * </pre>
031   * @param fn Action to run.
032   * @param millis Milliseconds for wait.
033   * @param onInterrupt Action if the thread is interrupted.
034   */
035  public static void run (Runnable fn, long millis, Runnable onInterrupt) {
036    new Thread(() -> {
037      try {
038        Thread th = new Thread(() -> {
039          try {
040            fn.run();
041          } catch (Exception e) {
042            onInterrupt.run();
043          }
044        });
045        th.start();
046        th.join(millis);
047        th.interrupt();
048      } catch (Exception e) {
049        onInterrupt.run();
050      }
051    }).start();
052  }
053
054
055  /**
056   * Start 'fn' in thread apart and returns its identifier to use with '.join'.<p>
057   * Example: <pre>
058   *    Thread th = Thr.start(() -> Task.process());
059   *    ...
060   *    th.join();
061   *    ...
062   * </pre>
063   * @param fn Action to run.
064   * @return The Thread created.
065   */
066  public static Thread start (Runnable fn) {
067    Thread th = new Thread(fn);
068    th.start();
069    return th;
070  }
071
072  /**
073   * Start 'fn' in thread apart, waiting at most 'millis' milliseconds. After
074   * this time the thread will be interrupted and 'onInterrupt' executed.<p>
075   * 'start' returns the thread identifier to use with 'join'.<p>
076   * Example: <pre>
077   *    Thread th = Thr.start(
078   *      () -> Task.process(),
079   *      2000,
080   *      () -> System.out.println("LOG--0")
081   *    );
082   *    ...
083   *    th.join();
084   *    ...
085   * </pre>
086   * @param fn Action to run.
087   * @param millis Milliseconds for wait.
088   * @param onInterrupt Action if the thread is interrupted.
089   * @return The Thread created.
090   */
091  public static Thread start (Runnable fn, long millis, Runnable onInterrupt) {
092    Thread th0 = new Thread(() -> {
093      try {
094        Thread th = new Thread(() -> {
095          try {
096            fn.run();
097          } catch (Exception e) {
098            onInterrupt.run();
099          }
100        });
101        th.start();
102        th.join(millis);
103        th.interrupt();
104      } catch (Exception e) {
105        onInterrupt.run();
106      }
107    });
108    th0.start();
109    return th0;
110  }
111
112
113  // SYNCHRONIZATION -----------------------------------------------------------
114
115  static Thread locked = null;
116
117  synchronized static void sync2 (Runnable fn) {
118    locked = Thread.currentThread();
119    fn.run();
120  }
121
122  /**
123   * Synchronizes 'fn'.<p>
124   * 'fn' must not call another function that calls 'sync' directly or
125   * indirectly.
126   * @param fn Function to synchronize.
127   */
128  public static void sync (Runnable fn) {
129    if (Thread.currentThread() == locked) fn.run();
130    else sync2 (fn);
131  }
132
133}
